channel.title: ToTheWeb by Rosemary Brisco
channel.itunes:author: ToTheWeb
channel.itunes:summary: ToTheWeb offers the proven website strategies and tactics you need to generate more qualified traffic, leads and sales. Count on our expertise to execute advanced search engine marketing programs to grow your business. We work with B2B companies to turn their website into a sales generating tool. We do that by ensuring that their websites achieve high visibility in the search engines. And once a visitor arrives, we capture that visitor and turn them into a lead prospect.
channel.description: ToTheWeb offers the proven website strategies and tactics you need to generate more qualified traffic, leads and sales. Count on our expertise to execute advanced search engine marketing programs to grow your business. We work with B2B companies to turn their website into a sales generating tool. We do that by ensuring that their websites achieve high visibility in the search engines. And once a visitor arrives, we capture that visitor and turn them into a lead prospect.

item.itunes:summary: I’m sure at some point you’ve struggled your way through a task and realized the problem is you don’t have the right tools to get the job done.

item.title: Paid Media: Should You Invest in Ads with Brand Keywords in Google?
item.itunes:author: ToTheWeb
item.itunes:subtitle: Paid Media: Should You Invest in Ads with Brand Keywords in Google?
item.itunes:summary: In the age of mobile, traditional organic listings appearing “below the fold” are an even more serious challenge. Mobile users may need to scroll in a big way to actually discover organic results.

item.title: Everything we do in SEO starts with Smart Keyword Selection
item.itunes:author: ToTheWeb
item.itunes:subtitle: Everything we do in SEO starts with Smart Keyword Selection
item.itunes:summary: Everything comes down to the words buyers use in Google whether typed into the browser, using voice dictation, spoken into devices like Amazon Echo, Google Home or in Apple’s Siri.

item.title: What Makes an AWESOME Blog Post? One that Continues to Deliver a Steady Stream of Traffic
item.itunes:author: ToTheWeb
item.itunes:subtitle: What Makes an AWESOME Blog Post? One that Continues to Deliver a Steady Stream of Traffic
item.itunes:summary: What makes an awesome blog post—a post that keeps generating traffic month after month? It’s a matter of looking at the data. Our Quick Wins guide will help you get started writing blog posts that continue to deliver traffic long after launch.

item.title: How Much Should You Pay for a PPC Lead? What Do Your Competitors Pay?
item.itunes:author: ToTheWeb
item.itunes:subtitle: How Much Should You Pay for a PPC Lead? What Do Your Competitors Pay?
item.itunes:summary: Pay-per-click (PPC) advertising is an effective way to generate website traffic. PPC is, in fact, the fastest road to being on Google’s first page for relevant search results, especially for highly competitive keywords. But how much should you pay? And how much are your competitors paying? Great questions but there is no short answer.

item.title: Top 10 Must-Have Online Tools to Efficiently Run your Business
item.itunes:author: ToTheWeb
item.itunes:subtitle: Top 10 Must-Have Online Tools to Efficiently Run your Business
item.itunes:summary: Every day, we use dozens of tools to communicate, run our web agency, and in working with clients.

item.title: What Wikipedia Can and Cannot Do For Your Business Part Two
item.itunes:author: ToTheWeb
item.itunes:subtitle: What Wikipedia Can and Cannot Do For Your Business Part Two
item.itunes:summary: Starting a new article about your business is tricky and difficult. First of all, Wikipedia does not advocate employees or owners start a Wikipedia entry about their own company. An important tenet of Wikipedia is third-party neutrality. A while ago, Microsoft got into some hot water for commissioning a third-party blogger to insert company-sponsored content onto a Wikipedia entry on OpenXML. If the Wikipedia community can track down the connection between third-party contributors and a company that sponsors them, it will have no trouble connecting the dots between you and the company article you’re attempting to post up.

item.title: Turn the "Heat" Up on your Website: Instantly See What Site Visitors Are Doing
item.itunes:author: ToTheWeb
item.itunes:subtitle: Turn the "Heat" Up on your Website: Instantly See What Site Visitors Are Doing
item.itunes:summary: Earlier this year I tested a tool called Crazy Egg that displays clicks as “heat maps” and now I can’t live without it!

item.title: 5 Steps to Optimize Images for Google Image Search
item.itunes:author: ToTheWeb
item.itunes:subtitle: 5 Steps to Optimize Images for Google Image Search
item.itunes:summary: Optimizing your images with file names and good alt tag descriptions is another easy way to let Google know the theme of your web pages, which in turn improves rankings. The result: more visitors!

item.itunes:summary: Not sure if your website is mobile-friendly? Enter a URL in Google’s Mobile-Friendly Testing tool and find out.

item.title: What Wikipedia Can and Cannot Do For Your Business Part One
item.itunes:author: ToTheWeb
item.itunes:subtitle: What Wikipedia Can and Cannot Do For Your Business Part One
item.itunes:summary: Wikipedia should be a part of your online strategy. Having a Wikipedia entry for your company adds credibility when it pops up in search rankings.

item.title: Build your Own SEO Reporting Dashboard
item.itunes:author: ToTheWeb
item.itunes:subtitle: Build your Own SEO Reporting Dashboard
item.itunes:summary:
How Does My Site Rank in Google?
As search marketers, our clients want to know how their sites are performing in Google. They want to know how often their web pages appear in Google’s organic search results and the keywords that triggered this result.

item.title: Best Practices for Optimizing PDF Files
item.itunes:author: ToTheWeb
item.itunes:subtitle: Best Practices for Optimizing PDF Files
item.itunes:summary: In the world of SEO optimization, PDFs often get short shrift. The big myth that search engines can’t digest PDF content used to be the case years ago, but the search engines have come a long way, baby. The truth is that the biggest reason PDF pages often rank so horribly is that they are rarely properly optimized for search engines.

item.title: Actionable Analytics. What are the Key Metrics When Analyzing Your Website Data?
item.itunes:author: ToTheWeb
item.itunes:subtitle: Actionable Analytics. What are the Key Metrics When Analyzing Your Website Data?
item.itunes:summary: Business Intelligence That Matters. Web Analytics CAN Be Sexy! The end of the month is fast approaching and it’s time for a deep-dive into analytics. There is SO much data you could easily drown without this blueprint for measuring what matters.
